.ansi-cyan-bg { background-color: #60C6C8; }
.ansi-cyan-intense-fg { color: #258F8F; }
.ansi-cyan-intense-bg { background-color: #258F8F; }
.ansi-white-fg { color: #C5C1B4; }
.ansi-white-bg { background-color: #C5C1B4; }
.ansi-white-intense-fg { color: #A1A6B2; }
.ansi-white-intense-bg { background-color: #A1A6B2; }

.ansi-bold { font-weight: bold; }
</style>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>This example shows how to couple differential equations and solve them numerically with python, on hand of protein refolding as a showcase. We will consider a very basic example neglecting effects like molecular crowding or the influence of chaperons on the refolding process. Protein refolding is a multi step process which can be described as outlined below:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">IPython.display</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">Image</span>
<span class="n">Image</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'./images/folding.png'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">width</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">400</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">height</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">400</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[6]:</div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea output_execute_result">
<img height="400" src="data:image/png;base64,
" width="400" />
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Ideally, the unfolded protein collapses into a partially folded state and folds completely into the native state. However, several unwanted side reactions can occur: the proteins can form aggregates with each other or partially folded protein can misfold.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The collapse into partially folded protein is usually very fast. Therefore we will consider only the folding step into native protein. An the simplest case, this reaction can be described by a first order model:</p>
<p>$$ \frac{dC_{folded}}{dt} =  k_{fold} \, C_{unfolded}$$</p>
<p>where $C_{unfolded}$ denotes the concentration of unfolded proteins, t denotes time and $k_{fold}$ the first order rate constant.</p>
<p>In the simplest case, protein aggregation happens during the collision of two protein molecules. It is not that simple because aggregates themselves can undergo aggregation with unfolded protein and other aggregated proteins. But lets stick to the simplest case for now, which is a second order reaction:</p>
<p>$$ \frac{dC_{agg}}{dt} = k_{agg} \, C_{unfolded}^2$$</p>
<p>We now have to connect everything together with a mass balance. In our simple case the total protein concentration has to stay constant. Under the assumption that the volume stays the same, we can write:</p>
<p>$$\frac{dC_{unfolded}}{dt} = - \frac{dC_{folded}}{dt} - \frac{dC_{agg}}{dt} $$</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Implementation-in-python">Implementation in python<a class="anchor-link" href="#Implementation-in-python">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>For convenience we will use the <a href="https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.integrate.odeint.html">odeint</a> interface. First, lets define our system of equations:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [13]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">scipy.integrate</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">odeint</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">pyplot</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="n">plt</span>
<span class="o">%</span><span class="k">matplotlib</span> inline
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">style</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">use</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'seaborn-muted'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [110]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">ode_refold</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">c</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">t</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">k_fold</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">k_agg</span><span class="p">):</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># lets create an array with length of 3 (folded, aggregated, unfolded)</span>
    <span class="n">dcdt</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">zeros</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="c1"># folded</span>
    <span class="n">dcdt</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">k_fold</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">c</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="c1"># aggregated</span>
    <span class="n">dcdt</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">k_agg</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">c</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">2</span>
    <span class="c1"># unfolded (has to be defined at last because we have to define dcdt[0] and dcdt[1] firs)</span>
    <span class="n">dcdt</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">dcdt</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">dcdt</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>    
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">dcdt</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Lets create the initial conditions and solve the system</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [140]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">c_unfolded</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10</span> <span class="c1"># mg/L</span>
<span class="n">c_foldet</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span> <span class="c1"># mol/L</span>
<span class="n">c_agg</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span> <span class="c1"># mol/L</span>

<span class="n">M</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">30000</span> <span class="c1"># Molar mass in Da</span>
<span class="c1"># the order is important. It has to match our definition in ode_refold(..)</span>
<span class="n">c0</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">c_foldet</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c_agg</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c_unfolded</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">M</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="c1"># now lets create a second set of starting conditions with lower initial concentration</span>
<span class="n">c1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">c_foldet</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c_agg</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c_unfolded</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">M</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="c1"># the rate constants</span>
<span class="n">k_fold</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">1e-4</span>  <span class="c1"># 1/s</span>
<span class="n">k_agg</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">3e-1</span>  <span class="c1"># 1/s</span>

<span class="c1"># create a vector of timepoints to solve on</span>
<span class="n">t</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">linspace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">4e4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># solve for the case of high initial protein concentration</span>
<span class="n">sol</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">odeint</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ode_refold</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">t</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">args</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k_fold</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">k_agg</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="c1"># solve for lower initial protein concentration</span>
<span class="n">sol1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">odeint</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ode_refold</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">t</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">args</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k_fold</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">k_agg</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="c1"># plot the solutions side by side with the suplots function</span>
<span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ncols</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">figsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="c1"># plot the solution at high initial protein concentratio</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sol</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">M</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">label</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'folded'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sol</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">M</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">label</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'aggregated'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sol</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">M</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">label</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'unfolded'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">legend</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'best'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># the syntax with ax. is slightly different than with plt.</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Initial concentration: </span><span class="si">{:0.1f}</span><span class="s1"> mg/mL'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">c0</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">M</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Concentration (mg/mL)'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Time (sec)'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># plot the solution at high initial protein concentratio</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sol1</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">M</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">label</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'folded'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sol1</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">M</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">label</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'aggregated'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sol1</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">M</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">label</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'unfolded'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">legend</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'best'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># the syntax with ax. is slightly different than with plt.</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Initial concentration: </span><span class="si">{:0.1f}</span><span class="s1"> mg/mL'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">c1</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">M</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="c1">#ax[1].set_ylabel('Concentration (mg/mL)')</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Time (sec)'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[140]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>Text(0.5,0,'Time (sec)')</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
" />
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The example above is purely theoretical but it highlights nicely why protein refolding usually requires large tank volumes. Typically, aggregation follows a second order kinetic, the rate of reaction is much more dependent on the initial protein concentration than the folding reaction. As a result, the yield of native protein decreases with increasing initial protein concentration.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Non-constant-rate-constants">Non constant rate constants<a class="anchor-link" href="#Non-constant-rate-constants">¶</a></h1>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>As mentioned before, proteins undergo folding only under suitable conditions. Typically, native proteins are prepared by dissolution of so called <a href="https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4379949/">inclusion bodies</a>. Typically, these inclusion bodies are dissolved under high urea (or other chaotropic agents) concentrations. One way to initialize refolding, is to dilute the solution with a buffer containing lower urea concentration. Upon dilution,</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>

entry.title: One dimensional diffusion across a membrane
entry.summary:
This notebook is inspired by the chapter "Cells and Diffusion" in the book Physiochemical and Environmental Plant Physiology. We will walk through a very simple example of 1 dimensional diffusion across a membrane and how to solve the differential equation numerically with python.

We will be using ode from scipy integrate package.

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>This notebook is inspired by the chapter "Cells and Diffusion" in the book <a href="http://www.robertocezar.com.br/documentos/livros/livros/plantphysiology.pdf">Physiochemical and Environmental Plant Physiology</a>. We will walk through a very simple example of 1 dimensional diffusion across a membrane and how to solve the differential equation numerically with python.</p>
<p>We will be using <a href="https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.integrate.ode.html">ode</a> from scipy integrate package.</p>
<p>If you are not familiar with python and the packages used here, get python from <a href="https://www.anaconda.com/download/#linux">anaconda</a> and follow a tutorial like the <a href="https://www.scipy-lectures.org/">scipy lecture notes</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="sd">''' We import the required libraries</span>
<span class="sd">'''</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">scipy.integrate</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">ode</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">odeint</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">pyplot</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="n">plt</span>

<span class="c1"># displaying plots inside the notebook (call this before you call plt.style.use())</span>
<span class="o">%</span><span class="k">matplotlib</span> inline
<span class="c1"># for a list of available styles see https://matplotlib.org/gallery/style_sheets/style_sheets_reference.html</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">style</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">use</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'seaborn-muted'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># For displaying images</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">IPython.display</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">Image</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Background">Background<a class="anchor-link" href="#Background">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Diffusion across a thin membrane can be described by the well known Fick's 1th law:</p>
<p>$$ \label{fick_1} J_j = - D_j \, \frac{\partial c_j}{\partial x}$$</p>
<p>The flux density $J_j$ is proportional to the diffusion coefficient $D_j$ of species $j$ and the concentration gradient $\frac{\partial c_j}{\partial x}$ in direction x. The flux density is given in in $mol \, m^{-2} \, s^{-1}$ and the diffusion coefficient in in $mol \, m^{-2} \, s^{-1}$.</p>
<p>The image below shows the case of 1 dimensional diffusion. By convention, a net flow in the direction of increasing x is positive. The minus sign in the equation is needed because flow occurs only towards region with lower concentration ($\partial c_j$ is negative if the concentration on the right side is lower).</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">Image</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'./images/1d_diffusion_membrane.png'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">height</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">250</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">width</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">250</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[5]:</div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea output_execute_result">
<img height="250" src="data:image/png;base64,
" width="250" />
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We could ask ourself the question how the concentration of a substance evolves over time if we place a drop if ink on the left side of the membrane shown above. Currently, we have a relationship between the flux across a membrane and the axial direction:</p>
<p>$$ J_j = - D_j \, \frac{\partial c_j}{\partial x}$$</p>
<p>There is no time there. What to do ?</p>
<p>We can follow the explanations on page 15 of the book <a href="http://www.robertocezar.com.br/documentos/livros/livros/plantphysiology.pdf">Physiochemical and Environmental Plant Physiology</a> and combine Ficks law with a so called <em>continuum equation</em></p>
<p>$$ \frac{\partial c_j}{\partial t} = -\frac{\partial J_j}{\partial x} $$</p>
<p>The equation states that the change of concentration over time for component $j$ is proportional to the change of the flux density over x. Combined with Fick`s Law we obtain:</p>
<p>$$ \label{fick_2} \frac{\partial c_j}{\partial t} = \frac{\partial}{\partial x} \left( -\frac{\partial J_j}{\partial x} \right) = -\frac{\partial^2 J_j}{\partial x^2}$$</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>If there is no obstruction between $x$ and $x+dx$ and the solute is placed at position 0, it is possible to derive an analytical expression for equation \ref{fick_2}. However, we would like to consider the diffusion across a membrane:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>If we neglect the boundary layers (between dashed lines) and discretize $\frac{\partial c_j}{\partial x}$ we can express equation \ref{fick_1} as:</p>
<p>$$\label{flux_K} J_j = D_j \, \frac{K_j \, (c_j^i - c_j^0)}{\Delta x} = P_j \, \frac{(c_j^i - c_j^0)}{\Delta x}$$</p>
<p>Because $D_j$ is the diffusion coefficient inside the membrane, we have to take the solubility $K_j$ of species $j$ inside the membrane into account. In order to make life simpler, we can define the permeability $P_j = D_j \, K_j / \Delta x$ and obtain following equation:</p>
<p>$$\label{flux_P} J_j  = P_j \, (c_j^i - c_j^0)$$</p>
<p>The permeability has the units $m \, s^{-1}$</p>
<p>Let $s_j$ be the amount (in moles) of substance $j$ inside the cell. If we consider that the flux density is is the rate of entry of substance per unit area, we can write:</p>
<p>$$\frac{ds_j}{dt} = J_j \,A = P_j \, A \, (c_j^i - c_j^0)$$</p>
<p>Because $s_j = c_j \, V$ and the Volume (V) inside the cell is nearly constant, we can write:</p>
<p>$$\label{1d_final}\frac{dc_j}{dt} = J_j \,A = \frac{P_j \, A}{V} \, (c_j^i - c_j^0)$$</p>
<p>We will use equation \ref{1d_final} for our calculations</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Time-to-get-the-hands-dirty">Time to get the hands dirty<a class="anchor-link" href="#Time-to-get-the-hands-dirty">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>There several convenient packages for solving differential equations:</p>
<ul>
<li><p><a href="https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy-1.0.0/reference/generated/scipy.integrate.odeint.html#scipy.integrate.odeint">odeint</a>: a simple interface to the FORTRAN library odepack. In many cases this is a good choice due to the simplicity of the interface.</p>
</li>
<li><p><a href="https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy-1.0.0/reference/generated/scipy.integrate.odeint.html#scipy.integrate.odeint">ode</a>: A generic interface to a couple of integrators. It is not as convenient as <em>odeint</em> but you can switch more easily between different integrators. Especially, <em>lsoda</em> might be interesting if the system is <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stiff_equation">stiff</a>.</p>
</li>
<li><p><a href="http://www.jmodelica.org/assimulo">assimulo</a>: a wrapper to a wide variety of solvers. Especially, if you would like to solve differential algebraic equations, <em>assimulo</em> might be very useful.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>We will use the <em>ode</em> and <em>odeint</em> interface for comparison.</p>
<p>Lets consider a simple example of one substance diffusing across a membrane:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="The-ode-interface">The ode interface<a class="anchor-link" href="#The-ode-interface">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="sd">''' Using the ode interface</span>
<span class="sd">'''</span>


<span class="n">perm</span>  <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">1e-9</span> <span class="c1"># typical permeability of small molecules in (m/s)</span>

<span class="c1"># of course the cell is a sphere :)</span>
<span class="n">area_membrane</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">1e-1</span> <span class="c1"># membrane area in (m^2)</span>
<span class="n">volume_left</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">1e-6</span> <span class="c1"># volume on the left side of the membrane in (m^3)</span>
<span class="n">volume_right</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">volume_left</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="mi">2</span> <span class="c1"># volume on right side of the memrane (initially concentration of 0)</span>

<span class="c1"># we need an initial condition for the concentration</span>
<span class="n">c_left</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">1e-3</span> <span class="c1"># mol/L</span>
<span class="n">c_right</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>  <span class="c1"># no substance outside</span>
<span class="n">y0</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">c_left</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="mi">1000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c_right</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="mi">1000</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="c1"># mol/^3</span>

<span class="c1"># and an initial condition for the time</span>
<span class="n">t0</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>

<span class="c1"># now we define the ode according to the scipy reference</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">ode_1d_diffusion</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">area_membrane</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">perm</span> <span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">volume_left</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">volume_right</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">dydt</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">zeros</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="c1"># describes the concentration change inside the cell</span>
    <span class="n">dydt</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span>   <span class="n">perm</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">area_membrane</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">volume_left</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">y</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">y</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>
    <span class="c1"># the change outside the cell </span>
    <span class="n">dydt</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span>  <span class="o">-</span><span class="n">dydt</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">volume_left</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">volume_right</span>
    
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">dydt</span>

<span class="n">r</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ode</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ode_1d_diffusion</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_integrator</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'lsoda'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">r</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_f_params</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">area_membrane</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">perm</span> <span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">volume_left</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">volume_right</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">r</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_initial_value</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">y0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">t0</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># we set a delta time at which we would like to obtain a solution</span>
<span class="n">dt</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10</span> <span class="c1"># second</span>
<span class="n">t_end</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10000</span>

<span class="c1"># This part might be a little bit inconvenient at firts. We have to iterate throug the timepoints</span>
<span class="c1"># and store the time in lists as well as the solutions for both concentrations</span>
<span class="n">t</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
<span class="n">sol</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
<span class="k">while</span> <span class="n">r</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">successful</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="ow">and</span> <span class="n">r</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">t</span> <span class="o"><</span> <span class="n">t_end</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">t</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">r</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">dt</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">sol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">r</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">integrate</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">r</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">dt</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="c1"># convert the lists to numpy array for more convenient indexingQ</span>
<span class="n">t</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">asarray</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">sol</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">asarray</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sol</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># plot the concentration on the left side of the membrane (by our function definition y[0])</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sol</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">label</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'left'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># plot the concentration on the left side of the membrane (by our function definition y[1])</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sol</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">label</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'right'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">legend</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="c1"># yes, matplotlib can handle Latex</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Concentration ($mol/m^3$)'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Time (s)'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Concentration over time'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[6]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>Text(0.5,1,'Concentration over time')</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
" />
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="The-odeint-interface">The odeint interface<a class="anchor-link" href="#The-odeint-interface">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="sd">''' Quite similar to the previous example</span>
<span class="sd">'''</span>


<span class="n">perm</span>  <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">1e-9</span> <span class="c1"># typical permeability in (m/s)</span>

<span class="c1"># of course the cell is a sphere :)</span>
<span class="n">area_membrane</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">1e-1</span> <span class="c1"># membrane area in (m^2)</span>
<span class="n">volume_left</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">1e-6</span> <span class="c1"># volume on the left side of the membrane in (m^3)</span>
<span class="n">volume_right</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">volume_left</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="mi">2</span> <span class="c1"># volume on right side of the memrane (initially concentration of 0)</span>

<span class="c1"># we need an initial condition for the concentration</span>
<span class="n">c_left</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">1e-3</span> <span class="c1"># mol/L</span>
<span class="n">c_right</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>  <span class="c1"># no substance outside</span>
<span class="n">y0</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">c_left</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="mi">1000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c_right</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="mi">1000</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="c1"># mol/^3</span>

<span class="c1"># and an initial condition for the time</span>
<span class="n">t0</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>

<span class="c1"># now we define the ode according to the scipy reference (NOTE: y,t are in different order than before)</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">ode_1d_diffusion</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">y</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">t</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">area_membrane</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">perm</span> <span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">volume_left</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">volume_right</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">dydt</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">zeros</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="c1"># describes the concentration change inside the cell</span>
    <span class="n">dydt</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span>   <span class="n">perm</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">area_membrane</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">volume_left</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">y</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">y</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>
    <span class="c1"># the change outside the cell </span>
    <span class="n">dydt</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span>  <span class="o">-</span><span class="n">dydt</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">volume_left</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">volume_right</span>
    
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">dydt</span>

<span class="c1"># The call to the solver is just one line</span>
<span class="n">t_end</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">linspace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1000</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">sol</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">odeint</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ode_1d_diffusion</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">t</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">args</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">area_membrane</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">perm</span> <span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">volume_left</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">volume_right</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="c1"># plot the concentration on the left side of the membrane (by our function definition y[0])</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sol</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">label</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'left'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># plot the concentration on the left side of the membrane (by our function definition y[1])</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sol</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">label</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'right'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">legend</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="c1"># yes, matplotlib can handle Latex</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Concentration ($mol/m^3$)'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Time (s)'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Concentration over time'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[10]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>Text(0.5,1,'Concentration over time')</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
" />
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Performance-of-both-solvers">Performance of both solvers<a class="anchor-link" href="#Performance-of-both-solvers">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Lets compare the speed of both solvers:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [14]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span><span class="k">timeit</span>
# we set a delta time at which we would like to obtain a solution
dt = 10 # second
t_end = 10000

# This part might be a little bit inconvenient at firts. We have to iterate throug the timepoints
# and store the time in lists as well as the solutions for both concentrations
t = []
sol = []
while r.successful() and r.t < t_end:
    t.append(r.t+dt)
    sol.append(r.integrate(r.t+dt))
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>328 ns ± 17.4 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 1000000 loops each)
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [17]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span><span class="k">timeit</span>
dt = 10 # second
t_end = 10000
n= t_end / dt
t_end = np.linspace(0, t_end, n)
sol = odeint(ode_1d_diffusion, y0, t, args=(area_membrane, perm , volume_left, volume_right))
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stderr output_text">
<pre>/home/moritz/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/ipykernel_launcher.py:4: DeprecationWarning: object of type <class 'float'> cannot be safely interpreted as an integer.
  after removing the cwd from sys.path.
</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>267 µs ± 39.1 µs per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 1000 loops each)
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The result is a bit odd because I did not expect that much of a performance difference. More in depth analysis would be necessary to see exactly where the difference originates from (e.g. using <a href="http://mortada.net/easily-profile-python-code-in-jupyter.html">line profiler</a>))</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>

entry.title: About this site
entry.summary:
What is this site about ?

Hi ! I am a bioprocess engineer who fascinated by the python ecosystem. Since I discovered python, I am learning every day new and interesting things. This blog is one of them.

If you have any questions, feedback or found spelling mistakes, please feel free to contact my per mail. If some of the code snippets might help you on your way, feel free to use them as you wish.
entry.content:

  /* Old browsers */

  display: flex;

}

}

}
.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */

  -webkit-touch-callout: none;

  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;
  /* Use default cursor */
  cursor: default;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {

    text-align: left;
  }
}
div.inner_cell {
  min-width: 0;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;

  display: -moz-box;

  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;

  -webkit-box-flex: 1;

  box-flex: 1;

  flex: 1;
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_area {
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  border-radius: 2px;
  background: #f7f7f7;
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there
   is no content in the output_subarea and the prompt. The main purpose of this is
   to make sure that empty JavaScript output_subareas have no height. */
div.prompt:empty {
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 0;
}
div.unrecognized_cell {
  padding: 5px 5px 5px 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;

  display: -moz-box;

}

}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a {

}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a:hover {
  color: inherit;

}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.unrecognized_cell > div.prompt {
    display: none;
  }
}
div.code_cell {
  /* avoid page breaking on code cells when printing */
}
@media print {
  div.code_cell {
    page-break-inside: avoid;
  }
}
/* any special styling for code cells that are currently running goes here */
div.input {
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */

    /* Modern browsers */

/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_prompt {
  color: #303F9F;
  border-top: 1px solid transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight {
  margin: 0.4em;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight > pre {
  margin: 0px;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
/* The following gets added to the <head> if it is detected that the user has a
 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See
 * notebookmain.js.  Such fonts will have keywords vertically offset with
 * respect to the rest of the text.  The user should select a better font.
 * See: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1503
 *
 * .CodeMirror span {
 *      vertical-align: bottom;
 * }
 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  padding: 0.4em;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. We need the 0 value because of how we size */
  /* .CodeMirror-lines */
  padding: 0;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay {
  height: 100%;
  padding: 0px 0.4em;
  position: absolute;
  border-radius: 2px;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {
  color: #D84315;
}
/* This class is the outer container of all output sections. */
div.output_area {
  padding: 0px;
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.output_area .MathJax_Display {
  text-align: left !important;
}
div.output_area 
div.output_area

div.output_area svg {
  max-width: 100%;
  height: auto;
}
div.output_area img.unconfined,
div.output_area svg.unconfined {
  max-width: none;
}
/* This is needed to protect the pre formating from global settings such
   as that of bootstrap */
.output {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;

}
@media (max-width: 540px) {

    /* Old browsers */

    display: -moz-box;

    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
div.output_area pre {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
  border: 0;
  vertical-align: baseline;
  color: black;
  background-color: transparent;
  border-radius: 0;
}
/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
  max-width: calc(100% - 14ex);
}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: visible;
}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {
  background: #fdd;
  /* very light red background for stderr */
}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */
div.output_javascript:empty {
  padding: 0;
}
.js-error {
  color: darkred;
}
/* raw_input styles */
div.raw_input_container {
  line-height: 1.21429em;

input.raw_input {
  font-family: monospace;
  font-size: inherit;
  color: inherit;
  width: auto;
  /* make sure input baseline aligns with prompt */
  vertical-align: baseline;
  /* padding + margin = 0.5em between prompt and cursor */
  padding: 0em 0.25em;
  margin: 0em 0.25em;
}
input.raw_input:focus {
  box-shadow: none;
}
p.p-space {

<p><strong>What is this site about ?</strong></p>
<p>Hi ! I am a bioprocess engineer who fascinated by the python ecosystem. Since I discovered python, I am learning every day new and interesting things. This blog is one of them.</p>
<p>If you have any questions, feedback or found spelling mistakes, please feel free to contact my per mail. If some of the code snippets might help you on your way, feel free to use them as you wish.</p>
</div>

        "    displayIndent: '0em'," +
        "    showMathMenu: true," +
        "    tex2jax: { " +
        "        inlineMath: [ ['$','$'] ], " +
        "        displayMath: [ ['$$','$$'] ]," +
        "        processEscapes: true," +
        "        preview: 'TeX'," +
        "    }, " +
        "    'HTML-CSS': { " +
        " linebreaks: { automatic: true, width: '95% container' }, " +
        "        styles: { '.MathJax_Display, .MathJax .mo, .MathJax .mi, .MathJax .mn': {color: 'black ! important'} }" +
        "    } " +
        "}); ";
    (document.body || document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0]).appendChild(mathjaxscript);
}
</script>
